TopicTitle: how do i enable shadows again?

Articles.Content: Shadows are missing... so I would like to know how to get them back.

Did you turn them off? If yes then start the game, go into settings, then click graphics and there it will say unedr a slider of terrain scatter the Shadow enabler (I think) That's how I turn them on/off
This may be a setting has got changed in your registry. See This Post for a quick'n'easy solution.
ty, I got it done. But somehow shadows can bring my fps of 120 to 40+... so i disabled them again
Is there a known fix for missing shadows on the Mac KSP client?
I've never touched a mac before so I don't know...
Sorry, but I'm afraid I don't know. Squad recently recruited some extra Mac-enabled testers, so maybe a fix for this will come out.

Well... I found this:

This information is generally stored in the Mac preferences (HD > Library > Preferences, or User > Library > Preferences). Although some are also in Library > Application Support.

from http://forums.macrumors.com/showthread.php?t=83562

If you can find the UnityGraphicsQuality setting in there, please let us know how you found it and how you changed it, so we can refer your solution to other users.

This may be a setting has got changed in your registry. See This Post for a quick'n'easy solution.

When I try this link it just tells me that I don't have permission to access that page...

So I found this video on Youtube and tried that. I changed the value to 3, but when I launched KSP, it automaticaly changed it back to 1.
